alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 6:12PM MST until August 20 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE ANTELOPE CREEK BASIN BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 610 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the Antelope Creek basin. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Rain has since stopped. However, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Additional rainfall this evening will be possible as scattered showers and thunderstorms move southeastward towards the Utah-Arizona border this evening. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Page, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Antelope Creek basin. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
